history.content:
Gave some advice on the multiple combinations of 54/16AB in @10667. Personally I would not recommend taking 127 if you haven't taken 16B or Math 110 yet. While 127 does do a significant amount of Linear Algebra review, it already assumes that you've taken 16B, and have a decently strong background in Math / Linear Algebra from the start, and then jumps into a bunch of other optimization topics assuming you remember most of the concepts from 16B.

I'd personally recommend taking 61B and 16B, and finishing your lower divs, before taking more upper div classes, since upper divs are much easier and enjoyable once you build the strong foundational skills in lower divs. I think 188 might also be a class worth taking, since you've taken 70 and Prob 140, although it may be a bit difficult if you haven't taken 61B. I'd also look into 61C even if you aren't that interested in hardware, since many upper div EECS classes will assume that you've taken 61C.

Hi, I plan to take CS 61B next semester and want some advice on the second technical course. I've taken Math 53 ,54, CS 61A, 70, Data 100 and Prob 140. How difficult is EECS 16B without taking EECS 16A? Is it doable to take 127 given classes I've taken? Besides EECS 16B and EE 127, are there any classes I can take together with CS 61B? Thanks for advice!
history.subject: SP20 Classes to take
